newsitem.title: GERMANY: German officials say Rhine flood danger over.
newsitem.headline: German officials say Rhine flood danger over.

text.p: German flood experts said on Saturday the danger of serious flooding in several towns had passed as the weather improved and the level of several rivers swollen by heavy rainfall subsided.
The Duisburg shipping office said the levels of the Rhine and three of its main tributaries, the Neckar, Mosel and Lahn, had all started falling.

In Bonn and Cologne, where the Rhine had spilled over its banks and flooded nearby streets on Friday, the water level reached a high point of over eight metres (yards) early on Saturday and then started to recede.
The Cologne flood control centre said the risk of serious flooding, last seen in the winters of 1993 and 1995, had passed.
